metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9650 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the management plugin in RabbitMQ 2.1.0 through 3.4.x before 3.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the download parameter to api/definitions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rabbitmq-server - 3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rabbitmq-server package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.2-2').
